meanings.definition: To include or integrate something back into a larger entity or organization.
meanings.sent1: The company reincorporates feedback from customers to improve their products.
meanings.sent2: She always reincorporates new ideas into her work to make it better.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle enthusiast reincorporates the missing piece and finally completes the picture.
meanings.sent4: Like a skilled chef, he reincorporates different flavors to create a harmonious dish.
meanings.sent5: The artist reincorporates elements of nature into her paintings, making them come alive.

meanings.definition: To bring something back into existence or use.
meanings.sent1: After years of neglect, she reincorporates her old hobby of painting.
meanings.sent2: The museum curator reincorporates ancient artifacts into the new exhibit.
meanings.sent3: The magician reincorporates a classic trick into his performance, delighting the audience.
meanings.sent4: The writer reincorporates forgotten tales into a modern novel, giving them new life.
meanings.sent5: The gardener reincorporates traditional planting methods to revive the dying garden.

meanings.definition: To combine or merge something again.
meanings.sent1: The chef reincorporates the separated ingredients to complete the dish.
meanings.sent2: The team leader reincorporates the different opinions to reach a consensus.
meanings.sent3: The mechanic reincorporates the parts of the engine, fixing the car.
meanings.sent4: The architect reincorporates the old design elements into the new building.
meanings.sent5: The teacher reincorporates the scattered ideas into a cohesive lesson plan.
